page.title: 10HEALTH
page.content: The South Warwickshire Authority administers two practices including 7 {doctors.}They are helped by Health Visitors, District Nurses, Social Workers, Chiropodists, Speech Therapists, Community Psychological and Psychiatric nurses and Midwives. The{hospitals}used by the practices are the Warneford at Leamington, Warwick (nearest casualty dept.), Stratford and the Hornton at Banbury. The Munro Devis Maternity Home is also used. The Little Thatch surgery dispenses for the area as there are no pharmacies within 1 mile. There is a {dentist}in the village although a lot of people travel out of the village for treatment. Teeth, particularly children's are generally healthy since the introduction of flouride into the water supply in 1974.
